column2: Reduce by at least 55% net GHG emissions compared to 1990 levels, by 2030
column5: This target is assigned to the GHG Reduction sub-theme because it directly aims to reduce greenhouse gas emissions. The target's focus on reducing emissions by a specific percentage makes it a clear fit for this sub-theme.

column2: Reduce by at least 55% net GHG emissions compared to 1990 levels, by 2030
column5: This target is also assigned to the Climate Resilience sub-theme because reducing GHG emissions is a key aspect of building climate resilience.

column2: Reduce methane emissions by 35 to 37% compared to 2005 levels, by 2030
column5: This target is assigned to the Methane sub-theme because it specifically focuses on reducing methane emissions.

column2: Reduce methane emissions by 35 to 37% compared to 2005 levels, by 2030
column5: This target is also assigned to the GHG Reduction sub-theme because methane is a potent greenhouse gas, and reducing its emissions contributes to overall GHG reduction.

column2: Reach energy neutrality in the wastewater treatment sector by 2045.
column5: This target is assigned to the Energy Efficiency sub-theme because achieving energy neutrality in the wastewater treatment sector implies reducing energy consumption and increasing energy efficiency.

column2: EU ETS. The contribution of the sectors covered by the existing EU Emission trading System (EU ETS) with respect to the EU Climate ambition should be of -62% compared to 2005
column5: This target is assigned to the GHG Reduction sub-theme because it aims to reduce emissions from sectors covered by the EU ETS.

column2: ETS2. Contribution of the buildings and road transport sectors of 43% emission reductions by 2030 compared to 2005
column5: This target is assigned to the GHG Reduction - Buildings sub-theme because it specifically mentions reducing emissions from the buildings sector.

column2: ETS2. Contribution of the buildings and road transport sectors of 43% emission reductions by 2030 compared to 2005
column5: This target is also assigned to the GHG Reduction - Transports sub-theme because it mentions reducing emissions from the road transport sector.

column2: ESR. Increased national targets in line with an EU- wide reduction of 40% in the ESR sectors compared to 2005
column5: This target is assigned to the GHG Reduction sub-theme because it aims to reduce emissions across various sectors.

column2: Achieve an EU net greenhouse gas removal of 310 million tonnes CO2 equivalent per year for the land use, land use change and forestry (LULUCF) sector, by 2030
column5: This target is assigned to the GHG Removal sub-theme because it focuses on achieving net greenhouse gas removals through land use, land use change, and forestry.

column2: No debit rule. For the period from 2021 to 2025, each Member State shall ensure that greenhouse gas emissions from the sector do not exceed greenhouse gas removals
column5: This target is assigned to the GHG Reduction sub-theme because it aims to balance emissions with removals, effectively reducing net emissions.

column2: Reduce buildings’ greenhouse gas emissions by 60%, by 2030
column5: This target is assigned to the GHG Reduction - Buildings sub-theme because it specifically focuses on reducing greenhouse gas emissions from buildings.

column2: REPowerEU sets a target of 10 million tonnes of domestic renewable hydrogen production and 10 million tonnes of renewable hydrogen imports by 2030
column5: This target is assigned to the Renewable Energy - Hydrogen sub-theme because it specifically mentions renewable hydrogen production and imports.

column2: Set up at least one renewables-based energy community in every municipality with a population higher than 10.000 by 2025
column5: This target is assigned to the Renewable Energy sub-theme because it promotes the setup of renewables-based energy communities.

column2: Member States shall ensure that the contribution of renewable fuels of non-biological origin used for final energy and non-energy purposes shall be at least 42% of the hydrogen used for final energy and non-energy purposes in industry by 2030
column5: This target is assigned to the Renewable Energy - Hydrogen sub-theme because it focuses on the use of renewable fuels of non-biological origin for hydrogen production.

column2: Double the current deployment rate of individual heat pumps, resulting in a cumulative 10 million units by 2027 and 30 million units by 2030
column5: This target is assigned to the Energy Efficiency - Buildings sub-theme because it aims to increase the deployment of heat pumps, which are energy-efficient solutions for heating.

column2: Bring online over 320 GW of solar photovoltaic by 2025 and almost 600 GW by 2030
column5: This target is assigned to the Renewable Energy - Solar sub-theme because it specifically focuses on increasing solar photovoltaic capacity.

column2: Energy demand to be covered by solar heat and geothermal should at least triple
column5: This target is assigned to the Renewable Energy - Heating & Cooling sub-theme because it mentions increasing the use of solar heat and geothermal energy for heating and cooling.

column2: Over this decade, the EU will need to install, on average, approximately 45 GW per year of PV to reach the share of 45% of energy coming from renewables
column5: This target is assigned to the Renewable Energy - Solar sub-theme because it specifically mentions installing PV capacity to increase the share of renewable energy.

column2: Member States shall collectively ensure that the share of energy from renewable sources in the Union’s gross final consumption of energy in 2030 is at least 42.5%
column5: This target is assigned to the Renewable Energy sub-theme because it aims to increase the overall share of energy from renewable sources.

column2: Member States shall set an indicative target for innovative renewable energy technology of at least 5% of newly installed renewable energy capacity by 2030
column5: This target is assigned to the Renewable Energy sub-theme because it promotes the development and installation of innovative renewable energy technologies.

column2: By 31 December 2025, each Member State shall agree to establish a framework for cooperation on joint projects with one or more other Member States for the production of renewable energy
column5: This target is assigned to the Renewable Energy sub-theme because it aims to foster cooperation among member states for the production of renewable energy.

column2: The amount of renewable fuels and renewable electricity supplied to the transport sector leads to a: (i) share of renewable energy within the final consumption of energy in the transport sector of at least 29 % by 2030
column5: This target is assigned to the Renewable Energy sub-theme because it focuses on increasing the share of renewable energy in the transport sector.

column2: Each Member State shall increase the share of renewable energy in the heating and cooling sector by at least 0.8 percentage points as an annual average calculated for the period 2021 to 2025
column5: This target is assigned to the Renewable Energy - Heating & Cooling sub-theme because it specifically aims to increase the share of renewable energy in the heating and cooling sector.

column2: By 2022, achieve 18% of the total increase in the share of energy from renewable sources between that Member State’s binding 2020 national target, and its contribution to the 2030 target
column5: This target is assigned to the Renewable Energy sub-theme because it aims to achieve a specific percentage of the total increase in the share of energy from renewable sources.

column2: Member States shall endeavour to increase the share of renewable sources in the amount of energy sources used for final energy and non-energy purposes in the industry sector by an indicative increase of at least 1.6 percentage points
column5: This target is assigned to the Renewable Energy sub-theme because it promotes the increase of renewable sources in the industry sector.

column2: A target of 15% electricity interconnection for 2030
column5: This target is assigned to the Energy Infrastructure sub-theme because it focuses on increasing electricity interconnection among member states.

column2: Indicative target of at least a 49% share of energy from renewable sources in the building sector in the Union’s final energy consumption in buildings in 2030
column5: This target is assigned to the Renewable Energy - Heating & Cooling sub-theme because it specifically aims to increase the share of renewable energy in the building sector.

column2: Member States shall ensure that the total final energy consumption of all public bodies combined is reduced by at least 1.9% each year, when compared to 2021
column5: This target is assigned to the Energy Efficiency sub-theme because it aims to reduce the total final energy consumption of public bodies.

column2: Member States shall collectively ensure a reduction of energy consumption of at least 11.7% in 2030 compared to the projections of the 2020 EU Reference Scenario
column5: This target is assigned to the Energy Efficiency sub-theme because it aims to reduce overall energy consumption.

column2: Member States shall make efforts to collectively contribute to the indicative Union primary energy consumption target amounting to no more than 992.5 Mtoe in 2030
column5: This target is assigned to the Energy Efficiency sub-theme because it aims to limit primary energy consumption.

column2: Each Member State shall ensure that at least 3% of the total floor area of heated and/or cooled buildings is renovated each year to be transformed into at least nearly zero-energy buildings
column5: This target is assigned to the Energy Efficiency - Buildings sub-theme because it focuses on renovating buildings to make them nearly zero-energy.

column2: Reduce buildings’ final energy consumption by 14%
column5: This target is assigned to the Energy Efficiency - Buildings sub-theme because it aims to reduce the final energy consumption of buildings.

column2: At least double the annual energy renovation rate of residential and non-residential buildings by 2030
column5: This target is assigned to the Energy Efficiency - Buildings sub-theme because it aims to increase the energy renovation rate of buildings.

column2: Reduce buildings’ energy consumption for heating and cooling by 18% compared to 2015 levels by 2030
column5: This target is assigned to the Energy Efficiency - Buildings sub-theme because it specifically focuses on reducing energy consumption for heating and cooling in buildings.

column2: Member states will have to renovate 16% of worst-performing non-residential buildings by 2030
column5: This target is assigned to the Energy Efficiency - Buildings sub-theme because it focuses on renovating worst-performing non-residential buildings.

column2: The national measures will have to ensure that at least 55% of the decrease of the average primary energy use is achieved through the renovation of the worst-performing buildings
column5: This target is assigned to the Energy Efficiency - Buildings sub-theme because it aims to achieve a significant portion of energy use reduction through renovating worst-performing buildings.

column2: Member States shall ensure that the average primary energy use of the entire residential building stock decreases by at least 16% compared to 2020 by 2030
column5: This target is assigned to the Energy Efficiency - Buildings sub-theme because it focuses on reducing the average primary energy use of the residential building stock.

column2: By 2030, the share of renewable energy in the electricity mix should double to 55-60%
column5: This target is assigned to the Renewable Energy sub-theme because it aims to increase the share of renewable energy in the electricity mix.

column2: Cumulative EU offshore goals of installed capacity: 60 GW by 2030 and 300 GW by 2050
column5: This target is assigned to the Renewable Energy - Ocean/Offshore sub-theme because it specifically focuses on increasing offshore installed capacity.

column2: The strategy sets targets for an installed capacity of at least 1 GW of ocean energy by 2030 and 40 GW by 2050
column5: This target is assigned to the Renewable Energy - Ocean/Offshore sub-theme because it aims to increase the installed capacity of ocean energy.

column2: Around 30% of EU primary steel production is expected to be decarbonised on the basis of renewable hydrogen
column5: This target is assigned to the Renewable Energy - Hydrogen sub-theme because it mentions the use of renewable hydrogen for decarbonizing steel production.

column2: Halve the amount of residual (non-recycled) municipal waste by 2030
column3: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column5: This target is assigned to the Waste Reduction - Municipal Waste sub-theme because it specifically aims to reduce residual municipal waste.

column2: Double EU’s circular material use rate in the coming decade
column3: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column5: This target is assigned to the Circularity/Recycling sub-theme because it aims to increase the circular material use rate.

column2: By 2030, Union extraction capacity should be able of extracting the ores, minerals or concentrates needed to produce at least 10% of the Union’s annual consumption of strategic raw materials
column3: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column5: This target is assigned to the Critical Raw Materials - Extraction & Import sub-theme because it focuses on increasing the Union's extraction capacity for strategic raw materials.

column2: By 2030, Union processing capacity, including for all intermediate processing steps, should be able of producing at least 40% of the Union’s annual consumption of strategic raw materials
column3: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column5: This target is assigned to the Critical Raw Materials - Extraction & Import sub-theme because it aims to increase the Union's processing capacity for strategic raw materials.

column2: Diversify the Union’s imports of strategic raw materials with a view to ensuring that, by 2030, the Union’s annual consumption of each strategic raw material at any relevant stage of processing can rely on imports from several third countries
column3: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column5: This target is assigned to the Critical Raw Materials - Extraction & Import sub-theme because it aims to diversify the Union's imports of strategic raw materials.

column2: By 2030, manufacturing capacity in the Union of the strategic net-zero technologies listed in the Annex approaches or reaches a benchmark of at least 40% of the Union’s annual deployment needs
column3: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column5: This target is assigned to the Net-Zero Technology - Manufacturing sub-theme because it focuses on increasing the manufacturing capacity of strategic net-zero technologies.

column2: By 2030, Union recycling capacity, including for all intermediate recycling steps, should be able of producing at least 25% of the Union’s annual consumption of strategic raw materials
column3: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column4: Circularity/Recycling - Critical Raw Materials - Batteries Recycling
column5: This target is assigned to the Circularity/Recycling - Critical Raw Materials - Batteries Recycling sub-theme because it aims to increase the Union's recycling capacity for strategic raw materials.

column2: Producers of starting, lighting and ignition batteries, industrial batteries and electric vehicle batteries or, where appointed in accordance with Article 57(1), producer responsibility organisations, shall take back, free of charge and without an obligation on the end-user to buy a new battery
column3: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column4: Circularity/Recycling - Critical Raw Materials - Batteries Recycling
column5: This target is assigned to the Circularity/Recycling - Critical Raw Materials - Batteries Recycling sub-theme because it focuses on the take-back and recycling of batteries.

column2: Producers of portable batteries or, where appointed in accordance with Article 57(1), producer responsibility organisations, shall attain, and maintain durably, at least the following collection targets for waste portable batteries
column3: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column4: Circularity/Recycling - Critical Raw Materials - Batteries Recycling
column5: This target is assigned to the Circularity/Recycling - Critical Raw Materials - Batteries Recycling sub-theme because it sets collection targets for waste portable batteries.

column2: Producers of LMT batteries or, where appointed in accordance with Article 57(1), producer responsibility organisations, shall attain, and maintain durably, at least the following collection targets of waste LMT batteries
column3: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column4: Circularity/Recycling - Critical Raw Materials - Batteries Recycling
column5: This target is assigned to the Circularity/Recycling - Critical Raw Materials - Batteries Recycling sub-theme because it sets collection targets for waste LMT batteries.

column2: For industrial batteries with a capacity greater than 2kWh, except those with exclusively external storage, electric vehicle batteries and starting, lighting and ignition batteries that contain cobalt, lead, lithium or nickel in active materials, the minimum recycled content percentage for each battery model per year and per manufacturing plant shall be
column3: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column4: Circularity/Recycling - Critical Raw Materials - Batteries Recycling
column5: This target is assigned to the Circularity/Recycling - Critical Raw Materials - Batteries Recycling sub-theme because it sets minimum recycled content percentages for industrial batteries.

column2: Any natural or legal person that places on the market products incorporating portable batteries shall ensure that those batteries are readily removable and replaceable by the end-user at any time during the lifetime of the product
column3: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column4: Circularity/Recycling - Critical Raw Materials - Batteries Recycling
column5: This target is assigned to the Circularity/Recycling - Critical Raw Materials - Batteries Recycling sub-theme because it aims to ensure that portable batteries are removable and replaceable.

column2: Recycling shall achieve at least the following targets for recycling efficiency
column3: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column5: This target is assigned to the Circularity/Recycling sub-theme because it sets targets for recycling efficiency.

column2: Recycling shall achieve at least the following targets for recycling efficiency
column3: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column5: This target is assigned to the Circularity/Recycling sub-theme because it sets targets for recycling efficiency of lithium-based batteries.

column2: All recycling shall achieve at least the following targets for recovery of materials
column3: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column5: This target is assigned to the Circularity/Recycling sub-theme because it sets targets for the recovery of materials.

column2: All recycling shall achieve at least the following targets for recovery of materials, 50% for lithium, no later than 31 December 2027, and 80% for lithium no later than 31 December 2031
column3: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column5: This target is assigned to the Circularity/Recycling sub-theme because it sets targets for the recovery of lithium.

column2: Reduce the generation of food waste in processing and manufacturing by 10% in comparison to the amount generated in 2020
column3: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column5: This target is assigned to the Waste Reduction - Food Waste sub-theme because it specifically aims to reduce food waste in processing and manufacturing.

column2: Reduce the generation of food waste per capita, jointly in retail and other distribution of food, in restaurants and food services and in households, by 30% in comparison to the amount generated in 2020
column3: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column5: This target is assigned to the Waste Reduction - Food Waste sub-theme because it aims to reduce food waste across various sectors.

column2: All packaging shall be recyclable
column3: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column5: This target is assigned to the Waste Reduction - Plastic & Packaging sub-theme because it aims to make all packaging recyclable.

column2: The plastic part in packaging shall contain the following minimum percentage of recycled content recovered from post-consumer plastic waste
column3: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column5: This target is assigned to the Waste Reduction - Plastic & Packaging sub-theme because it sets minimum percentages of recycled content in packaging.

column2: Achieve an annual production of sustainable biomethane of 35 billion cubic meters by 2030
column5: This target is assigned to the Biofuels sub-theme because it specifically mentions the production of sustainable biomethane.
